messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-SVDResizer in Stable Video Diffusion?
ComfyUI-SVDResizer is a helper for resizing the source image according to the sizes enabled in Stable Video Diffusion.
What is the rationale behind changing the size of the image in steps between 576 and 1024?

The rationale is based on the greatest common denominator of 576 and 1024, which is 64. This allows for resizing that is more likely to result in a coherent video that is not the standard size of 576X1024.
How does SVD handle resizing that adheres to the rule of using the greatest common denominator of 576 and 1024?
SVD is lenient with such resizing, increasing the chance of maintaining a coherent video that is not the standard size.
What is the recommended approach when adjusting the image sizes?
It is advisable to keep the value 1024 constant and play with the second size to maintain the stability of the result.
Can I see a demo of how ComfyUI-SVDResizer works?
Yes, a demo is available at the provided link: <https://github.com/ShmuelRonen/ComfyUI-SVDResizer/assets/80190186/3eeccc4d-fcc7-486e-b733-8fa3e985a3c1>
